api_esptool module¶

Classes:

AddrFilenamePairAction(option_strings, dest)

Custom parser class for the address/filename pairs passed as arguments

Args()

BaseFirmwareImage()

ELFFile(name)

ELFSection(name, addr, data)

Wrapper class for a section in an ELF image, has a section name as well as the common properties of an ImageSegment.

ESP32FirmwareImage([load_file])

ESP32 firmware image is very similar to V1 ESP8266 image, except with an additional 16 byte reserved header at top of image, and because of new flash mapping capabilities the flash-mapped regions can be placed in the normal image (just @ 64kB padded offsets).

ESP32ROM([port, baud])

Access class for ESP32 ROM bootloader

ESP32StubLoader(rom_loader)

Access class for ESP32 stub loader, runs on top of ROM.

ESP8266ROM([port, baud])

Access class for ESP8266 ROM bootloader

ESP8266StubLoader(rom_loader)

Access class for ESP8266 stub loader, runs on top of ROM.

ESPBOOTLOADER()

These are constants related to software ESP bootloader, working with ‘v2’ image files

ESPFirmwareImage([load_file])

‘Version 1’ firmware image, segments loaded directly by the ROM bootloader.

ESPLoader([port, baud])

Base class providing access to ESP ROM & softtware stub bootloaders.

FlashSizeAction(option_strings, dest[, …])

Custom flash size parser class to support backwards compatibility with megabit size arguments.

ImageSegment(addr, data[, file_offs])

Wrapper class for a segment in an ESP image (very similar to a section in an ELFImage also)

OTAFirmwareImage([load_file])

‘Version 2’ firmware image, segments loaded by software bootloader stub (ie Espressif bootloader or rboot)

SpiConnectionAction(option_strings, dest[, …])

Custom action to parse ‘spi connection’ override.

Wrapper class for runtime errors that aren’t caused by internal bugs, but by ESP8266 responses or input content.

Wrapper class for the error thrown when a particular ESP bootloader function is not implemented in the ROM bootloader.

class api_esptool.ESP32FirmwareImage(load_file=None)¶

Bases: api_esptool.BaseFirmwareImage

ESP32 firmware image is very similar to V1 ESP8266 image, except with an additional 16 byte reserved header at top of image, and because of new flash mapping capabilities the flash-mapped regions can be placed in the normal image (just @ 64kB padded offsets).

chip_id()¶

Read Chip ID from OTP ROM - see http://esp8266-re.foogod.com/wiki/System_get_chip_id_%28IoT_RTOS_SDK_0.9.9%29

flash_set_parameters(size)¶

Tell the ESP bootloader the parameters of the chip

Corresponds to the “flashchip” data structure that the ROM has in RAM.

‘size’ is in bytes.

All other flash parameters are currently hardcoded (on ESP8266 these are mostly ignored by ROM code, on ESP32 I’m not sure.)

flash_spi_attach(hspi_arg, is_legacy)¶

Send SPI attach command to enable the SPI flash pins

ESP8266 ROM does this when you send flash_begin, ESP32 ROM has it as a SPI command.

get_chip_description()¶
get_erase_size(offset, size)¶

Calculate an erase size given a specific size in bytes.

Provides a workaround for the bootloader erase bug.

read_mac()¶

Read MAC from OTP ROM

class api_esptool.ESPLoader(port='/dev/ttyUSB0', baud=115200)¶

Bases: object

Base class providing access to ESP ROM & softtware stub bootloaders. Subclasses provide ESP8266 & ESP32 specific functionality.

Don’t instantiate this base class directly, either instantiate a subclass or call ESPLoader.detect_chip() which will interrogate the chip and return the appropriate subclass instance.

connect(mode='default_reset')¶

Try connecting repeatedly until successful, or giving up

static detect_chip(port='/dev/ttyUSB0', baud=115200, connect_mode='default_reset')¶

Use serial access to detect the chip type.

We use the UART’s datecode register for this, it’s mapped at the same address on ESP8266 & ESP32 so we can use one memory read and compare to the datecode register for each chip type.

This routine automatically performs ESPLoader.connect() (passing connect_mode parameter) as part of querying the chip.

read_status(num_bytes=2)¶

Read up to 24 bits (num_bytes) of SPI flash status register contents via RDSR, RDSR2, RDSR3 commands

Not all SPI flash supports all three commands. The upper 1 or 2 bytes may be 0xFF.

run(reboot=False)¶
run_spiflash_command(spiflash_command, data=b'', read_bits=0)¶

Run an arbitrary SPI flash command.

This function uses the “USR_COMMAND” functionality in the ESP SPI hardware, rather than the precanned commands supported by hardware. So the value of spiflash_command is an actual command byte, sent over the wire.

After writing command byte, writes ‘data’ to MOSI and then reads back ‘read_bits’ of reply on MISO. Result is a number.

run_stub(stub=None)¶
soft_reset(stay_in_bootloader)¶
sync()¶
write(packet)¶
write_reg(addr, value, mask=4294967295, delay_us=0)¶
write_status(new_status, num_bytes=2, set_non_volatile=False)¶

Write up to 24 bits (num_bytes) of new status register

num_bytes can be 1, 2 or 3.

Not all flash supports the additional commands to write the second and third byte of the status register. When writing 2 bytes, esptool also sends a 16-byte WRSR command (as some flash types use this instead of WRSR2.)

If the set_non_volatile flag is set, non-volatile bits will be set as well as volatile ones (WREN used instead of WEVSR).

exception api_esptool.FatalError(message)¶

Bases: RuntimeError

Wrapper class for runtime errors that aren’t caused by internal bugs, but by ESP8266 responses or input content.

api_esptool.LoadFirmwareImage(chip, filename)¶

Load a firmware image. Can be for ESP8266 or ESP32. ESP8266 images will be examined to determine if they are original ROM firmware images (ESPFirmwareImage) or “v2” OTA bootloader images.

Returns a BaseFirmwareImage subclass, either ESPFirmwareImage (v1) or OTAFirmwareImage (v2).

exception api_esptool.NotImplementedInROMError(bootloader, func)¶

Bases: api_esptool.FatalError

Wrapper class for the error thrown when a particular ESP bootloader function is not implemented in the ROM bootloader.

api_esptool.arg_auto_int(x)¶
api_esptool.byte(bitstr, index)¶
api_esptool.check_supported_function(func, check_func)¶

Decorator implementation that wraps a check around an ESPLoader bootloader function to check if it’s supported.

This is used to capture the multidimensional differences in functionality between the ESP8266 & ESP32 ROM loaders, and the software stub that runs on both. Not possible to do this cleanly via inheritance alone.

Return a/b rounded up to nearest integer, equivalent result to int(math.ceil(float(int(a)) / float(int(b))), only without possible floating point accuracy errors.

api_esptool.expand_file_arguments()¶

Any argument starting with “@” gets replaced with all values read from a text file. Text file arguments can be split by newline or by space. Values are added “as-is”, as if they were specified in this order on the command line.

api_esptool.slip_reader(port)¶

Generator to read SLIP packets from a serial port. Yields one full SLIP packet at a time, raises exception on timeout or invalid data.

Designed to avoid too many calls to serial.read(1), which can bog down on slow systems.
